intro: Quercus welandii, commonly known as the Yucatán white oak, is a deciduous tree native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, chestnuts, and beeches. The tree is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in the fall. Its acorns are small and typically take about six months to mature. Quercus welandii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
